title: model is cooked

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

labels.name: invalid
labels.description: Issue identified as not relevant or not valid

body:
Type: Bug Yo, AI generalist here. I've been using claude sonnet 3.5 and 4 . This is a major problem i have been having. Now I cannot get the LLM to even remember basic instructions, it creates files and messes up code edits. It confuses itself and makes changes without my permission. It will add files that are not necessary. It cannot remember basic instructions like "reference" a file for build out and edits. This model has broken multiple working projects, wasted hundreds of hours going in circles. an example: in Master Prompting format, DO NOT STOP THE RUNNING SERVER, allow the server to run and stop creating new development servers, as we keep opening up terminals, this is unnecessary. The model will not even remember that. I promise you i have wasted money, time, and lost intellectual property due to using Claude instances to assist with code editing. Just now i have spent about 12 hours telling it the same thing: NO you did NOT FIX THE ERROR, I HAVE A 404 PAGE NOT FOUND, and it will say I fixed the error, it is running and should be working. I even ask it to allow an analysis on the page status as it opens up simple browser, it sees the 404 error and shows it, while the model just says fixed and done. I am tired of wasting time, money, energy, and operations, on a model that just supposedly received billions in funding. Laughable that it cant remember instructions. I have caught it lying to me about edits, being deceptive in the fact it is not telling me the truth in what it did. Imagine doing this for 6 months on a project. I need a response please from a dev, or cs, or somebody to resolve this as im wasting money and time . title: Differentiate between submodules and normal repos on virtual drives (Winows)

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: git
labels.description: GIT issues

body:
Type: Bug ### Steps to reproduce: 1. use the parent folder of a git root repository to create a new virtual drive over comand line: a. NET share "Z:"=%yourPath% b. SUBSET "Z:" %yourPath% -> A new drive Z appears under "Your PC" in the file explorer, containing the repository (and maybe other folders (and repositorys) next to this one) 2. Open VSC from Z: drive directly or the git root repository from Z: drive 3. open "Source Control" 4. Open the Repository view a. Confirm that both the repository and the submodule are listed b. Confirm that the submodule appears as a child of the repository c. Confirm that the repository/submodule have different icons ### Actual results: 4.a. passed 4.b. failed The repositories are shown without a visual hierarchic. 4.c. passed ### Configuration my `.gitmodules` file ```[submodule "m_a"] path = m_a url = ../m_a.git [submodule "40_b/overall"] path = 40_b/overall url = ../overall.git ``` my `.gitmodules` file in m_a: ```[submodule "m_s"] path = m_s url = ../m_s.git ``` see issue: [https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/43951#issuecomment-3140373027](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/43951#issuecomment-3140373027) VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.103.0-insider (724eea79bcad9a344a22eaecf949bca2f5f8f8bc, 2025-07-31T05:03:35.073Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.18363 Modes:

body: - Copilot Chat Extension Version: 0.30.3 - VS Code Version: 1.103.2 - OS Version: Windows 11 - Feature (e.g. agent/edit/ask mode): agent mode - Selected model (e.g. GPT 4.1, Claude 3.7 Sonnet): GPT 4.1 - Logs: Steps to Reproduce: 1. I have jest extension (Orta.vscode-jest v6.4.4) 2. I asked copilot to run a test file Actual - First it run the full test file, and then it started running one test/group at a time, then it started running one test inside each group at a time. So it run the test 16 time. Expected - It should have find all the tests result from 1st run then it can run two failing tests individually, so I was expecting maximum of 3 test run (1 full file test run is enough). Actual - Again after fixing the tests it run for 16 time. title: CodeArena

labels.name: invalid
labels.description: Issue identified as not relevant or not valid

body:
CodeArena is a new built-in feature for **Visual Studio Code** that combines learning, practicing, and showcasing coding skills directly inside the editor. Instead of switching between VS Code and platforms like LeetCode or HackerRank, developers can practice and track their progress in one place.

With CodeArena, developers can choose a programming language such as Python, Java, JavaScript, C++, or even SQL and start solving challenges right from their workspace. Each challenge comes with built-in test cases that run in the integrated terminal, giving instant feedback without leaving the editor.

The learning experience is structured in a level-based, gamified format. For example, a course on Arrays begins with Part 1 (Basics). Once a developer successfully completes all exercises in that section, Part 2 (Intermediate) is automatically unlocked. This creates a clear learning path and ensures steady progress without skipping fundamentals.

To keep developers motivated, CodeArena introduces daily challenges and streak tracking. Completing a challenge every day increases a streak count and awards XP points, making learning feel rewarding and engaging, much like a game.

Another highlight is the progress and ranking system. Developers can view their global or team ranking, track solved problems, and measure where they stand among peers. With a single click, they can also share their achievements on LinkedIn or GitHub, such as a badge that says “Completed Python Basics in CodeArena (VS Code)”.

For collaboration, CodeArena supports live coding rooms where friends or colleagues can solve problems together and compare solutions once finished. Solved problems can also be automatically saved into a GitHub repository, creating a personal portfolio of coding practice.

In short, CodeArena transforms VS Code into a complete coding practice hub — combining the power of daily learning, structured progress, global rankings, and professional profile building, all within the same editor developers already use every day.

title: Chat: Skipped fetch tool response still has some success text

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: fetch-tool
labels.description: Issues concerning the fetch internal tool and web extracting service

body: 1. Ask the Agent to `fetch https://google.com` 2. Skip the tool approval step 3. Open the Chat Debug view 🐛 The response has the following contents: ```txt Here is some relevant context from the web page https://google.com/: The user chose to skip the tool call, they want to proceed without running it ``` That first sentence is bogus, it should not appear in the subsequent prompts.

title: Fix tabstop calc in tokenizeLineToHTML()
body: Fixes https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/263386

title: tokenizeLineToHTML() misaligns tabs when startOffset > 0
body:
Type: Bug When startOffset is non-zero, tabsCharDelta doesn't accumulate chars before charIndex, and the first \ ends up short on padding in generated HTML. This causes clipboardCopyWithSyntaxHighlightingAction command to return incorrect padding on the first line in its output if we start selection with text after the first column. **Source location:** [src/vs/editor/common/languages/textToHtmlTokenizer.ts](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/main/src/vs/editor/common/languages/textToHtmlTokenizer.ts) VS Code version: Code - OSS Dev 1.104.0 (Commit 0a565d144fea, Date Mon Aug 25 23:41:01 2025 -0700) OS version: Linux x64 6.14.0-28-generic Modes:

title: fix (macos): app not closing on cmd+q (only windows close)

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

body:
## Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code on macOS.
Press Cmd + Q to quit the app.
2. Observe:
    - All windows close.
    - The app remains in the dock and Cmd + Tab app switcher.
    - Pressing Cmd + Q again results in a screen flash and error sound (if system if configured to alert on os error)
    - Only way to fully quit is via the "Code" menu → "Quit Visual Studio Code".

## Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?:
Yes

## System info

Version: 1.100.1
Commit: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/commit/91fa95bccb027ece6a968589bb1d662fa9c8e170
Date: 2025-05-09T15:43:50.040Z (1 wk ago)
Electron: 34.5.1
ElectronBuildId: 11369351
Chromium: 132.0.6834.210
Node.js: 20.19.0
V8: 13.2.152.41-electron.0
OS: Darwin arm64 24.4.0

## Previously

This issue was posted here <https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/249179> and closed then crash report data was not provided. This isn't a crash, however. Just a UX bug.

body:
Description:
Since today, the model selection option in Copilot Chat (VS Code) has disappeared. Earlier, I was able to switch between different models (e.g., GPT-4, Claude, etc.), but now the dropdown is missing.

Additionally, when I try to ask something in Copilot Chat, it only shows “working” or “Build with agent mode. AI responses may be inaccurate.” but no actual response is returned.

I have confirmed that this is happening across multiple systems, so it does not seem to be a local setup issue.

Steps to reproduce:

Open VS Code.

Open Copilot Chat panel.

Observe that the model selection dropdown is missing.

Try to ask a query → no response is received.

Expected behavior:

Model selection dropdown should be visible.

Queries should return responses normally.

Environment:

VS Code (latest version)

GitHub Copilot extension (latest version)

macOS

title: [Feature Request] Make Auto (Variable) model selection respect visible model picker options
body:
### Feature Request

I would like **Auto (Variable)** model selection to only choose from models that are actually visible in the model picker dropdown, rather than including models that users have disabled or that don't appear in the list.

### Current Behavior

- Some models are disabled in GitHub settings (e.g., Gemini)
- These models don't appear in VS Code's model picker dropdown
- However, when selecting Auto (Variable), it may still choose these hidden/disabled models

### Suggested Improvement

Auto (Variable) should:
- Only select from models visible in the user interface
- Respect user preferences set in GitHub settings
- Allow users to predict which models Auto might choose from

### Benefits

- More intuitive user experience
- More predictable model selection behavior
- Consistency between user settings and actual behavior

### Environment

**VS Code:**
- Version: 1.104.0-insider (user setup)
- Commit: ee25c1fab76e99da2f8215debfeba3220dacdb00

title: Add configurable prompt file suggestions with when-clause support
body: ## Summary This PR introduces a new `promptFilesRecommendations` configuration setting that allows users to configure which prompt files should be suggested in the chat welcome view based on contextual when-clause expressions or simple boolean values. cc @eli-w-king ## Key Features - **Contextual suggestions**: Configure prompt files to appear based on file type, language, or other VS Code context - **Flexible configuration**: Support both boolean values (`true`/`false`) and when-clause expressions - **Smart caching**: Async loading of prompt descriptions to avoid blocking UI rendering - **Unified experience**: Suggestions now work in both experimental and regular welcome views ## Configuration Example ```json { "promptFilesRecommendations": { "plan": true, // Always suggest "a11y-audit": "resourceExtname == .html", // Only for HTML files "document": "resourceLangId == markdown", // Only for Markdown files "debug": false // Never suggest } } ``` ## Implementation Details ### Configuration Schema - Added proper JSON schema with `oneOf` constraints supporting mixed boolean/string types - Comprehensive validation and error handling for when-clause parsing - Experimental tag with clear documentation and examples ### UI Integration - Enhanced `ChatWidget` with intelligent prompt suggestion logic - Added description caching to avoid async calls during rendering - Graceful fallback when descriptions fail to load ### Welcome View Improvements - Moved suggested prompts rendering outside experimental-only blocks - Updated re-render logic to account for prompt suggestion changes - Added helpful onboarding message when no agent-specific welcome exists ## Testing - ✅ Configuration parsing handles various input types correctly - ✅ When-clause evaluation integrates properly with VS Code context system - ✅ Error handling gracefully degrades on invalid configurations - ✅ UI updates correctly when suggestions change ## Related Issues Enhances the reusable prompts feature by making suggestions context-aware and user-configurable. ## Breaking Changes None - this is an additive feature with sensible defaults.

title: Tokenization/syntax highlighting breaks intermittently in SCSS files.

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

body: Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Unknown - intermittent and no obvious reproduction steps. Extension Bisect doesn't help since restarting/reloading VSCode temporarily fixes the issue. - VS Code Version: 1.103.2 - OS Version: macOS 15.2 (Darwin arm64 24.2.0) Steps to Reproduce: Unknown - manifests in a number of different situations. ### Issue I opened an issue over a year ago about this but abandoned it since I had a lot going on and didn't have the time or energy. The issue has never gone away and I'm back with renewed motivation to figure it out. It only happens in SCSS files for me, but I've seen other issues describing very similar problems in other languages. The syntax highlighting simply breaks, but only part of the way through the file. Sometimes it happens when I'm editing, sometimes when I simply scroll down, seeing the highlighting briefly before it disappears (sort of propagates with scroll... sometimes). This is project independent. For the first time, I've come across a file where I can make it happen on demand. No idea why but, in this file specifically, adding a newline after the colon breaks the highlighting below that line. I can do this in my other SCSS files without the issue manifesting itself. Here are the editor tokens and scopes on a property name where the highlighting is not working. As we can see, the scopes are correctly detected and it even shows which color it should be applying. Here are the editor tokens and scopes a few lines up, same property name, where the highlighting is working. Everything is the same as the broken one. This is the markup in the inspector for the line with the broken highlighting shown above. There appears to be no markup or classnames for the entire line (except `.mtk1`). In contrast, this is the markup for the equivalent line where the highlighting isn't broken. At first, when I would save the file and the newline was removed, it would fix the highlighting. But just now I saved it and the highlighting issue is still there, without the newline. ### Workarounds I've found three: - restarting the editor - closing and reopening the file tab (sometimes switching tabs works, but not always) - commenting and uncommenting the affected lines (or the whole file) Below is what happens when I comment and uncomment a single line within the affected range of lines: ### Troubleshooting The only SCSS related extension I have is Stylelint. I tried disabling it which made no difference. I've tried disabling "Editor > Semantic Highlighting". I've tried using different themes, including the built-in options. Thanks!

title: Golden Scenarios: Installing Extension-bundled MCP

labels.name: chat-mcp-management
labels.description: Issues related to browsing and managing MCP Servers in VS Code

body:
Bundling MCP servers with extensions provides a lot of benefits for easier distribution and shipping user-facing interfaces with agent-facing tools.

But installing MCP server is a lot more fragmented than the extension install flows. This issue tracks the scenarios that need reliably work as expected to install the extension instead of MCP servers.

1. **Install via Link**: User installs a Azure MCP server from GitHub page — Opens extension page instead to install the Azure extension.
3. **Install via Search**: User searches "azure" in VS Code's MCP search — Should list the Azure extension that opens the extension page.
4. **Workspace**: User opens a workspace with `vscode/mcp.json` that lists `azure` MCP server — MCP server is ignored, but is treated as an extension recommendation for Azure extension.
5. **Existing MCP Installation**: User has `azure` MCP already installed or added manually by copy/pasting JSON — User gets prompted to confirm that the Azure MCP server can be removed and replaced with the Azure extension.

@sandy081 does that align with your expectations how extension-bundled MCP servers should be handled?

cc @connor4312

title: Can't tell I cancelled session from chat sessions view

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

body: Related: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/263348 I cancelled a coding agent session, and the status of the session moved from the blue in-progress indicator to the green completed indicator: I would've expected a different indicator for a cancelled session.

title: Can't tell I cancelled session from chat editor history
body: - I cancelled a coding agent session using the stop button in the chat editor (steps described further here https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/263347) - I was told `Session cancelled` in the chat editor output log, which made sense - I closed out of this chat editor and then reopened it - ❔ The log output is a bit unexpected: - There are many instances of `view` - - I don't see any mention that I cancelled the session - - The editor tab is just titled `Chat`, rather than something more specific - Captured as part of https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/259038#issuecomment-3221934566

title: Unexpected `Send` option in coding agent dropdown
body: - Do some planning in local agent mode - Delegate a task to coding agent via cloud button - New chat editor opens - I consider stopping the coding agent session - ❔ I wouldn't expect this `Send` dropdown option: I cancelled the session, and I still see `Send` as a dropdown option. I'm not sure what it would do:

title: Expect some response when I try to use chat send buttons without a prompt
body: I believe @joshspicer recently updated the cloud button so that it's still clickable (rather than grayed out) even if a user doesn't have a prompt, so that it aligns with the existing chat send button: I like that these 2 buttons are now aligned, but I find it unexpected that they're clickable when there's no prompt. I'd expect either: - They're both grayed out and unclickable if I haven't typed anything, or - I get some sort of chat message or notification that I need to type to be able to send the message

I have these 2 methods that I am writing in a FastMCP Server ``` @app.post("/register") async def oauth_dynamic_registration(request: Request): """ Proxy dynamic client registration requests to Okta """ body = await request.body() print("oauth_dynamic_registration") # Proxy to Okta's dynamic registration endpoint okta_url = "https://xx.oktapreview.com/oauth2/v1/clients" async with httpx.AsyncClient() as client: response = await client.post( okta_url, content=body, headers={ "Content-Type": "application/json", "Authorization": "SSWS xxxx" # Okta API token } ) print(response.content) # print(response.headers) return Response( content=response.content, status_code=response.status_code, headers=dict(response.headers) ) # MCP well-known endpoint @app.get("/.well-known/oauth-protected-resource/mcp") async def oauth_protected_resource_metadata(): """ OAuth 2.0 Protected Resource Metadata endpoint for MCP client discovery. Required by the MCP specification for authorization server discovery. """ return { "authorization_servers": [settings.OKTA_AUTHORIZATION_SERVERS], "bearer_methods_supported": ["header"], "resource": settings.OKTA_RESOURCE_NAME, "resource_documentation": settings.OKTA_RESOURCE_DOCS_URL, "scopes_supported": [ "xx.skill.call" ] } ``` and below are the logs for the same. ``` INFO: Uvicorn running on http://localhost:10000 (Press CTRL+C to quit) INFO: 127.0.0.1:49271 - "POST /mcp HTTP/1.1" 401 Unauthorized oauth_protected_resource_metadata {'authorization_servers': ['https://xxx.oktapreview.com/oauth2/default/v1/authorize'], 'bearer_methods_supported': ['header'], 'resource': 'http://localhost:10000/mcp', 'resource_documentation': 'http://localhost:10000/mcp/docs', 'scopes_supported': ['xx.skill.call']} INFO: 127.0.0.1:49272 - "GET /.well-known/oauth-protected-resource/mcp HTTP/1.1" 200 OK oauth_dynamic_registration 2025-08-25 17:29:34,038 - httpx - INFO - HTTP Request: POST https://xx.oktapreview.com/oauth2/v1/clients "HTTP/1.1 201 Created" b'{"client_id":"xx","client_id_issued_at":1756157373,"client_name":"Visual Studio Code","client_uri":"https://code.visualstudio.com","logo_uri":null,"redirect_uris":["https://insiders.vscode.dev/redirect","https://vscode.dev/redirect","http://localhost","http://127.0.0.1","http://localhost:33418","http://127.0.0.1:33418"],"response_types":["code"],"grant_types":["authorization_code","refresh_token","urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:device_code"],"token_endpoint_auth_method":"none","application_type":"native"}' INFO: 127.0.0.1:49287 - "POST /register HTTP/1.1" 201 Created ``` Based on the logs seems like the client was registered but after this finishes, VSCode states that DCR is not supported The authorization server 'https://xxx.oktapreview.com/oauth2/default/v1/authorize' does not support automatic client registration. title: Feature Request: Sound Notification & Auto-Retry for Copilot Agent
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

I’d like to suggest a feature that could make a real difference in day-to-day use of Copilot Agent inside VS Code.

### 1. A simple sound when the Agent finishes
When the Agent completes its work, it would be great if VS Code could play a short optional sound. In practice, many of us don’t just sit and stare at the Agent waiting for it to finish — we’re often switching to other parts of the project, reading docs, or handling parallel tasks.  
The problem is, you don’t always notice when the Agent is done, which leads to unnecessary pauses. A quick sound cue would solve this very neatly.

### 2. Auto-retry with a timer
Sometimes the Agent stops mid-way or fails unexpectedly. Right now, that means you have to go back and manually re-trigger it, which interrupts the workflow.  
If there was an option to set a timer (for example, “retry automatically if no output after X seconds”), it would help keep the process smooth and avoid wasted time.

---

### Why this matters
For professional developers, flow and speed are critical. These two small features could remove a lot of friction:  
- No more waiting around or constantly checking if the Agent is done  
- No more manual retries when the Agent hangs  

It’s a practical quality-of-life improvement that would make Copilot Agent feel much more reliable and efficient in everyday use.

title: 413 Request Entity Too Large" error in long chat sessions
body:
Type: Bug ### Description I am frequently encountering the "Request Failed: 413 Request Entity Too Large" error, especially when using the GitHub Copilot Chat feature. The error seems directly related to the length of the conversation history being sent with each new request. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Start a new chat session with GitHub Copilot in VS Code. 2. Engage in a moderately long conversation (typically after 15-20 back-and-forth messages). 3. After the conversation history has grown, send a new prompt to the chat. ### Actual Result The request fails, and the following error message is displayed: `"Sorry, your request failed. Please try again. Request id: [id] Reason: Request Failed: 413 Request Entity Too Large"` ### Expected Result The chat should process the request and provide a response without a network error. Alternatively, a warning about the context limit being reached before the error occurs would be a better user experience. ### Impact This issue significantly disrupts the development workflow. It forces me to start a new chat session, which results in losing the entire context of the ongoing conversation, reducing the effectiveness of the tool. title: Test: input request detection for terminals/tasks
body: Refs https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/258252 - [x] Windows @nguyenchristy - [x] macOS @aiday-mar - [x] Linux @justschen Complexity: 4 Authors: @meganrogge, @tyriar [Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23263329%0A%0A&assignees=meganrogge,tyriar) --- When the `run_task` or `run_in_terminal` tools are invoked, we now evaluate the output to determine if there's a request for user input. If so, we prompt the user to run the response in the terminal. We provide the default or first option as the primary action. We include other options in the dropdown menu. In the below example, you'd be prompted to run `y` in the terminal with `n` in the dropdown. To validate this behavior: - Run commands that explicitly ask for user input. - Create scripts that require multiple confirmations in sequence (e.g., license acceptance followed by overwrite confirmation). - Test various shells - Run tasks, foreground terminals, and background terminals (specify in your request "in background terminal") - While prompts are present, try typing in the terminal. If you do so, the prompt should hide. - When options and descriptions are provided, for example `[Y] Yes [N] No` etc, we surface these in the confirmation prompt. For example, you could create a `test.ps1` file, set your default terminal profile to `pwsh`, and ask the chat agent to `Run test.ps1 in a background terminal`. ``` $title = 'File Operation' $question = 'Multiple files need to be processed. How would you like to proceed?' $choices = '&Yes', 'Yes to &All', '&No', 'No to A&ll', '&Cancel' $decision = $Host.UI.PromptForChoice($title, $question, $choices, 0) switch ($decision) { 0 { Write-Host "Processing current file..." -ForegroundColor Green } 1 { Write-Host "Processing all files..." -ForegroundColor Green } 2 { Write-Host "Skipping current file..." -ForegroundColor Yellow } 3 { Write-Host "Skipping all files..." -ForegroundColor Yellow } 4 { Write-Host "Operation cancelled." -ForegroundColor Red exit } } $subTitle = 'Confirmation' $subQuestion = 'No pick a color?' $subChoices = '&Blue', '&Red' $subDecision = $Host.UI.PromptForChoice($subTitle, $subQuestion, $subChoices, 0) if ($subDecision -eq 0) { Write-Host "Confirmed. Continuing..." -ForegroundColor Green } else { Write-Host "Action aborted by user." -ForegroundColor Red exit } ```

title: Test: compound tasks in agent mode
body:
Refs https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/258241

- [x] Windows @joshspicer 
- [x] macOS @joaomoreno 
- [x] Linux @connor4312 

Complexity: 3


[Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23263328%0A%0A&assignees=meganrogge)

---

We now support running compound tasks, like the `VS Code - Build` task using agent mode. 

Please try this out with other compound tasks that are defined in your workspace. It should indicate that it's getting output for each of the dependent tasks.

title: Test: agent mode task problem matcher error detection
body:
Refs #261516

- [x] Windows @bhavyaus 
- [x] macOS @alexdima 
- [x] Linux @justschen 

Complexity: 3


[Create Issue](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/new?template=blank&body=Testing+%23263327%0A%0A&assignees=meganrogge)

---

In the previous iteration, we introduced output polling for the `run_task, get_task_output, and create_and_run_task tools`. This relied on the LLM to detect and report errors, but had the drawback of surfacing stale issues from earlier compilation that were still present in the terminal buffer.

For tasks with `problemMatchers`, `beginsPattern`, and `endsPattern`, we've improved that approach by collecting and surfacing the problem matcher results instead of using the LLM for evaluation. This ensures that errors are reported only when relevant to the current task execution.

In addition, we’ve improved how problems are presented. They now appear in the dropdown of a chat progress message, allowing users to navigate directly to the problem location with a single click.

Try this out by asking the agent to run some tasks, like the VS Code Build task, with and without errors. 

Note that conversation summarization seems to confuse the agent. So, between tests, please create new chat sessions.

# Fix #-mentions search for files and folder backspace bug

## Reproduction Steps
- have a folder called test with a file called index.md
- user types #t and "test" shows up as a result
- user blackspaces
- user types #t again

expected:
- "test" folder should show

actual:
- nothing shows

---

Additionally, you can see a large variance in search results with you type a part of a filename (e.g "hel" attempting to match a file called "hello.js"). When you first start typing, the results show quite well. Once to backspace, immediately all relevant values drop off.

---
Apologies in advance, I have not tested this and I am hoping to get some help to understand how to do that.

labels.name: *caused-by-extension
labels.description: Issue identified to be caused by an extension

body:
When using Bun with VSCode, setting "debug.javascript.autoAttachFilter": "smart" does not attach the debugger if running in a normal terminal. It only works in the JavaScript Debug Terminal.

Steps to reproduce:

Set "debug.javascript.autoAttachFilter": "smart" in settings.json.

Open a normal terminal in VSCode (zsh).

Run a Bun script (bun run ...).

Observe that the debugger does not attach automatically.

Expected behavior:
Debugger should attach automatically in a normal terminal, similar to Node.js.

title: Copilot does not index files inside attached folders (only individual files), but indexing works when the full codebase is attached
body: - Copilot Chat Extension Version: Latest - VS Code Version: Latest - OS Version: Windows 11 - Feature (e.g. agent/edit/ask mode): Ask and Edit mode (not tested on Agent mode) - Selected model (e.g. GPT 4.1, Claude 3.7 Sonnet): All models - Logs: When attaching an entire codebase, Copilot Chat is able to index and reference files correctly (shown as “searching in codebase”). However, when only a specific folder is attached via “Add Context → Files and Folders”, Copilot does not index the contents of that folder. Instead, it only references the directly attached files, ignoring nested files inside the folder. - Expected Behavior: Copilot should index and use all files inside the attached folder, similar to when the full codebase is attached. - Actual Behavior: Copilot only sees the attached folder name and direct files, not the nested files inside it. - Screenshots: When attaching codebase: “searching in codebase” works correctly. When attaching a folder: “used references” only lists the file attached directly. Steps to Reproduce 1.Open a project in VS Code (e.g. ClassicOldSong/Apollo). 2. In Copilot Chat, click Add Context → Files and Folders... 3. Attach a folder that contains multiple files (e.g. src_assets). 4. Ask a query about something inside a file in that folder.
